slides.title: Next.js Fundamentals
slides.subtitle: The React Framework for Production
slides.description: Da Vercel (2016) a Next.js 16 (2025) - Server Components, App Router, e full-stack magic
slides.ironicClosing: Next.js: React ma production-ready out-of-the-box. Magia nera o best practices? Entrambi.

slides.title: üìú La Storia di Next.js
paragraphs: 2016: Vercel (ex ZEIT) crea Next.js - "React con SSR facile"
2019: Next.js 9 - API routes (backend nel frontend!), automatic static optimization
2020: Next.js 10 - Image optimization, i18n routing, Analytics
2021: Next.js 12 - Middleware, React 18, SWC compiler (Rust-based, 3x faster)
2022: Next.js 13 - App Router (rivoluzione), Turbopack beta, Server Components
2023: Next.js 14 - Server Actions stable, Partial Prerendering
2024: Next.js 15 - React 19, Turbopack stable per dev, async Request APIs
2025 (Ottobre): Next.js 16 - Cache Components, Turbopack stable production, React Compiler
Oggi: Framework React pi√π popolare. Usato da: TikTok, Twitch, Notion, Hulu, Nike
slides.ironicClosing: Da 'React con SSR' a 'full-stack framework'. Ambitious creep fatto bene.

slides.title: üöÄ Next.js 16 (2025) - Latest
paragraphs: ‚Ä¢ use cache directive per controllo granulare
‚Ä¢ Dynamic by default, cache solo quando serve
‚Ä¢ Bundler di default per dev E production
‚Ä¢ File system caching beta - startup ultraveloce
‚Ä¢ Scritto in Rust, fino a 700x pi√π veloce di Webpack
‚Ä¢ Automatic memoization - no pi√π useMemo/useCallback manuali
slides.ironicClosing: Next.js 16: Turbopack ovunque, cache opt-in, React Compiler. Developer happiness level: max.

slides.title: Perch√© Next.js?
paragraphs: React, ma meglio: Routing, SSR, SSG, ISR built-in (no config hell)
Full-stack: API routes, Server Actions, database queries direttamente in componenti
Performance: Image optimization, font optimization, code splitting automatico
SEO-friendly: Server-side rendering, metadata API, sitemap generation
Developer Experience: Fast Refresh, TypeScript first-class, error overlay incredibile
Deployment: Vercel (zero config), ma anche self-hosted ovunque
‚Ä¢ Create React App: Deprecato, Next.js √® il successore ufficiale
‚Ä¢ Remix: Ottimo, ma ecosystem Next.js √® pi√π grande
‚Ä¢ Gatsby: Solo SSG, Next.js fa tutto (SSG + SSR + ISR)
Casi d'uso: Landing pages, e-commerce, dashboard, blog, SaaS, tutto
slides.ironicClosing: Next.js: il framework che fa s√¨ che CRA sembri un giocattolo. RIP CRA, 2016-2023.

slides.title: App Router
slides.subtitle: Il nuovo modo di fare routing in Next.js
slides.description: Da Pages Router (legacy) ad App Router (moderno) - Server Components by default

slides.title: App Router vs Pages Router
paragraphs: ‚Ä¢ Ancora supportato, ma non raccomandato per nuovi progetti
‚Ä¢ async/await direttamente nei componenti per data fetching
‚Ä¢ Layouts, loading states, error boundaries built-in
Migrazione: Graduale. Puoi usare entrambi (ma non mescolare nella stessa route)
slides.ironicClosing: Pages Router: comfort zone. App Router: future-proof. Scegli saggiamente (App Router).

slides.title: Server vs Client Components
slides.subtitle: Il paradigma chiave di Next.js App Router
slides.description: Server Components by default, Client Components quando serve

slides.title: Server Components (default)
paragraphs: ‚Ä¢ Zero JavaScript inviato al client (bundle pi√π piccolo)
‚Ä¢ Accesso diretto a backend (database, filesystem, API)
Default in App Router: Tutti i componenti sono Server Components a meno che 'use client'
slides.ironicClosing: Server Components: zero JS al client. React ma senza React nel browser. Mind-blowing.

slides.title: Client Components
paragraphs: ‚Ä¢ Componenti che renderizzano sul server E reidratano sul client
Best practice: Usa Client Components il meno possibile. Leaf components.
slides.ironicClosing: Client Components: React classico. Server Components: React del futuro. Scegli saggiamente.

slides.title: üíª Server Component (default)
slides.explanation: Server Component: async, database access, zero JS client. Default nell'App Router.

slides.title: üíª Client Component
slides.explanation: 'use client' per interattivit√†. useState, onClick, ecc. OK. JS inviato al browser.

slides.title: üíª Composition Pattern (Best Practice)
slides.explanation: Composition: Server Component wrappa Client. Minimizza bundle. Best practice chiave.

slides.title: üíª Passare Props: Server ‚Üí Client
slides.explanation: Server ‚Üí Client: solo props serializable (JSON). No functions, Date, refs.

slides.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Errori Comuni Server/Client
paragraphs: Fix: Aggiungi 'use client' o sposta logica in Client Component
async function in 'use client' component ‚Üí Non supportato
Fix: Usa useEffect + fetch, o Server Component
3. Import Client in Server senza props
Prisma/DB call in 'use client' ‚Üí Fallir√† (no backend access)
Fix: Sposta in Server Component o usa API route
page.tsx intera con 'use client' ‚Üí Bundle enorme
Fix: Solo leaf components interattivi con 'use client'
slides.ironicClosing: Server/Client boundary: confonde all'inizio, naturale dopo. Come React Hooks nel 2019.

slides.title: üíª Docker Deployment

code.snippet:
# Dockerfile (multi-stage)
FROM node:20-alpine AS base

# Dependencies
FROM base AS deps
RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci

# Builder
FROM base AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

# Runner
FROM base AS runner
WORKDIR /app
ENV NODE_ENV production

RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs
RUN adduser --system --uid 1001 nextjs

COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/standalone ./
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/static ./.next/static

USER nextjs
EXPOSE 3000
ENV PORT 3000

CMD ["node", "server.js"]

# docker build -t nextjs-app .
# docker run -p 3000:3000 nextjs-app

slides.explanation: Docker: multi-stage build. Standalone output. Production-ready container.
